If you haven't played half-life 2 then what are you waiting for?!Go play this masterpiece of a game and a giant achievement in video gaming development and I love the story and that there are cutscenes only if they're essential to the story,my final rating is 10/10 it is a classic and if you haven't played this masterpiece then play it already!
Its half life 2. there's a reason its known by all
Classic, one of the most iconic PC games.

I had always heard people say that half life was a fantastic franchise, but (I thought) I couldn't use my dinosaur of a laptop. well I decided that ill just buy both half life and half life 2 because they were on sale for $2 each. best decision of this year. turns out, you can run half life on a toaster and half life 2 on a microwave. I only experienced one tiny frame drop in the entire campaign for half life. and remember, I'm playing on an ancient, virus filled laptop. And half life 2, I turned the graphics all down to medium and it runs at a usable frame rate. not perfect, but it doesn't make it unplayable. I really enjoyed half life, got about $15 worth of game for $2. half life 2 is much better. I've played for about 2 hours and It's already one of my new favorite games. my only complaint so far is how long Water Hazard (a level in the game) is. seriously. that's the level I'm on right now, and its been going for way too long. for the first 20ish minutes it was a nice breath of fresh air. now It's annoying. the gun they added didn't really spice anything up, it just added more annoying enemies. But so far, that's my only complaint. Side note, Xen in the first game is terrible. 10/10 so far, would be 11/10 but Water Hazard is really annoying.

Welcome. Welcome to City 17.

You have chosen, or been chosen, to relocate to one of our finest remaining urban centers. I thought so much of City 17 that I elected to establish my Administration here, in the Citadel so thoughtfully provided by Our Benefactors. I have been proud to call City 17 my home. And so, whether you are here to stay, or passing through on your way to parts unknown, welcome to City 17. It's safer here.
